Agentic Elixir superpowers: Zed + Tidewave + AshAI

6 June 25

dev

For a few years now whenever I need to build any sort of networked interactive experience, I reach for Elixir (with Phoenix LiveView and Ash). Itâ€™s an extremely productive combination, especially when you want to do more complex client/server information flows than the standard request/response UX. Iâ€™ve also (for the last year or two) ditched Emacs for Zed. Again, if you take the time to master these tools I think theyâ€™re excellent.

Like every indie hacker and their wombat Iâ€™m experimenting with LLM Agents as part of my software development workflow. The new frontier (which Iâ€™m excited about, but ask me in a few months how itâ€™s gone) is putting all of the above together. If youâ€™d like to do that too, and want to see a real-world example of how these things can be plugged into one another, hereâ€™s my setup.

  • Zed as the text editor/MCP host
  • both Tidewave and AshAI as MCP servers

Then, my Zed settings file has this MCP server configuration:

"context_servers": {
  "ash_ai": {
    "command": {
      "path": "mcp-proxy",
      "args": ["http://localhost:4000/ash_ai/mcp"],
      "env": {}
    },
    "settings": {}
  },
  "tidewave": {
    "command": {
      "path": "mcp-proxy",
      "args": ["http://localhost:4000/tidewave/mcp"],
      "env": {}
    },
    "settings": {}
  }
},

Even after following the instructions for those tools, youâ€™ll need a way to set up all the proxies and pipe everything together. I wrote this script, which youâ€™re free to use (MIT Licence) if it helps.

Put it on your ~PATH and then (in your Phoenix project root) run it like so:

[16:03] daysy:panic $ tidewave-proxy.sh
ðŸš€ MCP Proxy Development Environment

âœ… mcp-proxy for tidewave started (PID: 88816)

ðŸŽ‰ MCP Proxy environment is ready!
=====================================

Available MCP Servers:
  ðŸ“Š Ash AI MCP:    http://localhost:4000/ash_ai/mcp
  ðŸŒŠ Tidewave MCP:  http://localhost:4000/tidewave/mcp

MCP Proxy Commands:
  For Ash AI:    mcp-proxy http://localhost:4000/ash_ai/mcp
  For Tidewave:  mcp-proxy http://localhost:4000/tidewave/mcp

Next Steps:
1. Configure your MCP client (Zed, Claude Desktop, etc.)
2. Use the endpoints above with your MCP client
3. Test with: curl -H 'Accept: application/json' <endpoint>

Log Files:
  Ash AI Proxy: /tmp/mcp_ash_ai.log
  Tidewave Proxy: /tmp/mcp_tidewave.log

Press Ctrl+C to stop all services and clean up

Then, to test, in the Agent panel try something like:

Use the tidewave project eval tool to add 10+15 in Elixir.

If everythingâ€™s hooked up right, youâ€™ll get the answer.

One other tip: make sure youâ€™re using OTP27 rather than the (newest) OTP28---thereâ€™s an error on one of the AshAI deps which stops it compiling on the latest OTP. I suspect itâ€™ll be fixed soon, though.
